attributes.action: Require MPs to be dependant on the key services that make up our society
attributes.additional_details:
MPs should pledge that  they will live by...

* No private health insurance, for them and their immediate family. The NHS should work for everybody.

* MPs children go to the local school, no selection, no fees. There may well be fee-paying or selective schools in the area, but the basic option should be suitable for everybody.

* No external income. If MPs are being paid, directly or indirectly, by 3rd parties, their focus may not be on improving the country for everybody.
attributes.background: I believe that our ruling bodies should govern for the good of the masses and that the only way that can happen successfully is if they have to rely on the services that make up our society, the NHS and the public education services.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether to pay for private healthcare or education are a matter for every individual, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Ban second jobs for Members of Parliament: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/630900
